greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array read by upwards antidiagonals: T(m,n) is the number of simple 3-connected triangulations of a closed region in the plane with m+3 given external edges and 3n+m internal edges, m>=0, n>=1.
comment: A triangulation is simple if it contains no separating 3-cycle. There are n interior nodes and m+3 nodes on the boundary. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 24 2021
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1325
P. N. Rathie, A census of simple planar triangulations, J. Combin. Theory, B 16 (1974), 134-138.
William T. Tutte, A census of planar triangulations, Canad. J. Math. 14 (1962), 21-38.
formula: G.f. of row m > 0: R(x) satisfies g(x^2)^(m+1)*R(x*g(x^2)) = B(x^2) where g(x) is the g.f. of column 0 of A341856 and B(x) is the g.f. of column m of A341856.
G.f. of row m > 0: h(x)^(m+1)*B(x*h(x)^2) where 2-h(x) is the g.f. of A000256 and B(x) is the g.f. of column m of A341856.
example: The array transposed for comparability with A341856 begins:
program: (PARI) \\ here H is A000256 as g.f., U(n,m) is A341856 for m > 0.
R(N, m)={my(g=2-H(N)); Vec(if(m==0, 1-g, g^(m+1)*subst(O(x*x^N) + sum(n=1, N, U(n,m)*x^n), x, x*g^2)))}
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 28 2012
ext: Terms a(21) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 23 2021
